P001824.project_name: Integrated Rural and Urban Poverty Project

keywords.cdata: accounting,agriculture,assets,auditors,balance of payments,Balance Sheet,Balance Sheets,bank deposits,Banking System,borrowing,Cash Flow,Cash Flow Statements,central bank,certain extent,commercial banks,commercial credits,Construction,construction loans,credit policies,debt,deposits,development banking,development projects,Disbursement,dividends,employment,equity investments,Expenditure Statements,exports,extreme poverty,Financial Intermediation,financial markets,financial policies,FINANCIAL SECTOR,Financier,food production,Forecasts,Foreign Exchange,GDP,GDP per capita,growth rate,housing,housing construction,housing finance,housing loans,imports,Income,Income Statements,inflation,inflation rate,interest rate,Interest Rates,Liquidity,net worth,oil,organizational structure,Portfolio,public enterprises,smallholder agriculture,subsidiaries,subsidiary,Technical Assistance,unemployment,urbanization,Zoning

project_abstract.cdata: The proposed project includes three separate components to provide financial and technical assistance: (i) to the industrial sector for development of small- and medium-scale enterprises promising substantially lower investment costs per job than currently; (ii) to the artisan sector for rehabilitating and expanding the production of knotted carpets by decentralizing production and improving training of weavers; and (iii) to the agricultural sector for development of 30 new irrigated schemes under village cooperatives, including an adequate credit scheme. The project also provides consulting services to study the feasibility of establishing a gypsum plaster brick industry to replace expensive imported cement with locally made bricks, and of creating a new industrial zone in the capital city of Nouakchott.
